result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone F. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Tyrone F. Brown was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyrone F. Brown is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Tyrone F. Brown was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Tyrone F. Brown was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Tyrone F. Brown was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Tyrone F. Brown was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Tyrone F. Brown was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. 
*If revoked and sentenced to prison. The department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account of reasonable amounts as determined by DOC to be used for payment of obligations. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision. If  discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. 
*All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No contact with M. Deates unless with the prior approval of Ms. Deates and the supervising agent.
No contact with his daughter (A.B.) without the consent of the supervising agent.  If that can be done in a safe manner, then the Court would encourage the contact. 
Comply with any assessments, treatment or programs deemed appropriate by the agent and COMPASS assessment.
Sign all necessary releases of information as requested by the agent.
Pay all financial obligations including court ordered obligations and supervision fees as directed by the agent. 
Attend and successfully complete the Batterers Program as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Submit a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrone F. Brown in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt.  Defendant Tyrone Brown in custody.  Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:49 p.m. Court calls the case. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 
He did anticipate that she would be here today.  (It is unclear if the victim is actually present). 
No victim wishes to address the court.  

Court has received the PSI.  
Atty Molepske has received a copy of the PSI and has no corrections or additions. 
Atty Schmidt has received a copy of the PSI and reviewed that with his client.  States corrections for the record. 

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  
Count 2 -
44 months prison with 18 months Initial Confinement followed by 36 months Extended Supervision - STAYED - 
Consecutive to Counts 1, 4 & 6. 
Placed on probation for 3 years.

Count 5 - 
44 months prison with 18 months Initial Confinement followed by 36 months Extended Supervision - STAYED - 
Concurrent with Count 2. 
Consecutive to Counts 1, 4 & 6.
Placed on probation for 3 years.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Programs.

Conditions of Supervision in Counts 2 & 5: 
No contact with Michelle Deates unless with the prior approval of Ms. Deates and the supervising agent.
No contact with his daughter (A.B.) without the consent of the supervising agent.  If that can be done in a safe manner, then the Court would encourage the contact. 
Comply with any assessments, treatment or programs deemed appropriate by the agent and COMPASS assessment.
Sign all necessary releases of information as requested by the agent.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment. 
Pay all financial obligations including court ordered obligations and supervision fees as directed by the agent. 
Attend and successfully complete the Batterers Program as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Submit a DNA sample. 
Pay costs on each count.  
On Count 2 - Pay the $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge. 

Count 1 - 
Serve 9 months jail. 
67 days credit on this count. 
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason allowed by the sheriff. 
Allowed to serve the second half of the sentence on the home monitor program if he qualifies for that program. 
Pay costs.
Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant is remanded to the custody of the sheriff. 
Sentence to commence immediately. 

Count 4 - 
Serve 90 days jail. 
Concurrent with Count 1. 
Same huber privileges and home monitor opportunity. 
67 days credit.
Pay costs.  To be paid within the next 60 days or set up a payment plan. 

Count 6 - 
Serve 120 days jail. 
Concurrent with Counts 1 & 4. 
Same huber privileges. 
Pay costs.  To be paid within the next 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Submit a DNA sample. 
67 days credit. 

State retains his copy of the PSI in his file confidentially. 
Court provides the defendant with a copy of the Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Corrected Count 4

Exhibit #P1 Photo of Right Hand of the Victim
   Exhibit #P2 Photo of Phone Case on Top of Vehicle
   Exhibit #P3 Photo of Feet/Sandals of the Victim

8:04 a.m. Day 2 - Clerk: MP
Defendant Tyrone F. Brown in court with Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. District Attorney (DA) Louis Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court calls the case. DA Molepske states the appearances.

8:04 a.m. All 12 Jurors are escorted into the Courtroom. Court addresses the Jurors and welcomes them back to the Courtroom.

8:05 a.m. Court gives closing instructions to the Jurors. Court reads all 12 verdict forms for the record.

8:13 a.m. Clerk administers Oath of Officers.

8:14 a.m. Jurors are excused to start deliberations. Jury instructions and verdict forms will be provided to them.

Court advises parties as to remaining calendar. Parties are to remain close to the Courtroom.

8:15 a.m. Court is in recess.

9:59 a.m. Court is back on the record outside the presence of the jury. Appearances are as previously stated. Court has received a note from the jurors. Court reads the note for the record. Jury would like the definition of the word maliciously as it relates to Count 1.

Court has reviewed the Jury Instruction for Count 1.
DA Molepske makes statements to the Court.
Atty Schimidt concurs with the statements and makes additional statements to the Court.

Court reads footnote roman numeral 7 to Jury instruction for Count 1 and questions the parties as to sending the footnote back to the jurors.
DA Molepske agrees to sending the footnote back to the jurors.
Atty Schmidt concurs.

10:06 a.m. Bailiff shows note and response to parties.
No objection by either party.

10:07 a.m. Response is stapled to the note which is sent to the jury.

10:07 a.m. Court is back in recess.

11:14 a.m.  Court is back on the record outside the presence of the jury. Appearances are as previously stated. Court has been informed jurors have reached a verdict. Court cautions and reminds everyone to remain quiet during the verdict

11:16 a.m. Jurors enter the courtroom.
Foreperson hands the paperwork to the Bailiff, who hands to the Court.

Court reads the verdict.

Verdict as to Count 2:
Guilty

Verdict as to Count 3:
Not Guilty

Verdict as to Count 4:
Guilty

Question:
No

Verdict as to Count 1:
Guilty

Question:
No

Verdict as to Count 5:
Guilty


Verdict as to Count 6:
Guilty.

11:20 a.m. Court questions the jurors as to the verdict.
All 12 jurors have responded that the verdict is their verdict.

Court sincerely appreciates Jurors and gives one last instruction.
Service is completed. Court addresses Jurors, are free to talk to anyone they want, but only if they want.

11:23 a.m. Jurors are excused at this time.

DA Molepske moves the Court to enter a judgment of conviction.
Atty Schmidt makes statements to the Court regarding Count 1.

BY THE COURT:
Judgment of Coviction as to Count 1 shall be a Class A Misdemeanor.(940.44)

Atty Schmidt makes statements regarding Count 4 enhancer.

BY THE COURT:
Judment of Conviction as to Counts 4 shall be a Misdemeanor.
Judgment of Conviction shall be entered on Count 2. 
Judgment of Acquittal shall be entered on Count 3.
Judgment of Conviction shall be entered on Counts 5 & 6.

DA Molepske questions the counts.
Court responds.

Court questions sentencing.
Atty Schmidt requests a PSI.
DA Molepske makes statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
PSI is ordered. Matter to set for sentencing hearing on July 13, 2018 at 1:30 p.m.
PSI to be available 1 week prior to sentencing.

DA Molepske request bond be revoked and makes statements in support of the request.
Atty Schmidt responds and requests the bond be continued..

BY THE COURT:
Bond is revoked.
Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff's Office.

11:32 a.m. Court is in recess.

8:19 a.m. Day 1: Morning Clerk: Shelley
Defendant Tyrone F. Brown in court with Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. District Attorney (DA) Louis Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Exhibit's #P1-#P3 are marked for the State.

Jurors are pre-seated and Jurors chosen are:  1855, 1764, 1907, 1896, 1893, 1930, 1931, 1844, 1922, 1790, 1891, 1765, 1863, 1890, 1802, 1845, 1910, 1888, 1774, 1832.

8:33 a.m.  Case is called and the appearances are stated.
Court welcomes the Jurors and gives a few introductory remarks.
20 Jurors have been selected.  Court indicates that 12 Jurors will be drawn, with each party having 4 strikes.  
8:41 a.m.  Clerk administers the Voir Dire Oath.
Court reads the charges, as stated in the Information, to the Jurors.
8:45 a.m.  Court administers Voir Dire to the Jurors.
Court releases Juror's #1896 and #1845.
Juror 1896 is replaced with Juror 1916.
Juror 1845 is replaced with Juror 1788.
8:55 a.m.  Court releases Juror 1863.
Juror 1863 is replaced with Juror 1772.
**Potential witnesses are:   A. D-B., M. D., Former Plover Officer A. Hopfensperger and Plover Officer N. Shulfer.
8:58 a.m.  Court releases Juror 1764.
Juror 1764 is replaced with Juror 1792. 
9:03 a.m. Court releases Juror 1910.
Juror 1910 is replaced with Juror 1885.
9:04 a.m.  Court release Juror 1885.
Juror 1885 is replaced with Juror 1846.
9:07 a.m.  Atty Molepske administers Voir Dire to the Jurors.
9:33 a.m.  Atty Schmidt administers Voir Dire to the Jurors.
9:37 a.m.  Atty Schmidt would ask that Juror 1931 be excused.
Court makes statements to Juror 1931.
9:40 a.m.  Court releases Juror 1931.
Juror 1931 is replaced with Juror 1805.
9:42 a.m.  Parties begin their peremptory strikes.
Court provides the Jurors with information as to what the rest of the day will look like.
Jurors chosen for the jury panel are:  1765, 1790, 1802, 1805, 1844, 1846, 1855, 1890, 1891, 1893, 1916 and 1930.
9:51 a.m.  Jurors not chosen are excused from the jury box.
9:52 a.m.  Clerk administers the Juror Oath.
Court gives the chosen jurors further instructions.
9:53 a.m.  Court thanks the jurors not chosen and they are excused for the remainder of the day.
Jurors have left the courtroom.
Parties have received a stipulation with regards to certain issues.
9:55 a.m.  Atty Schmidt agrees, with the Court, that it is appropriate to address the stipulated issues at this time and these are stated on the record.
9:56 a.m.  Defendant is in agreement with the stipulated facts.
Court questions the defendant.
9:58 a.m.  After questioning by the Court the defendant still wishes to stipulate to the facts as stated on the record by the Court.
Court questions Atty Schmidt.
Court questions Atty Molepske.
BTC:  Defendant has freely, voluntarily and knowingly stipulated to the facts as stated on the record.
10:00 a.m.  Atty Molepske makes statements on the record.
Atty Molepske would ask that the agreed facts be read to the Jurors prior to the first witness being called; Atty Schmidt is in agreement.
10:01 a.m.  Court is in recess.
10:13 a.m.  Court is back in session and parties remain as they were prior to the morning recess.
Atty Molepske states that Officer Shulfer  will be present at the plaintiff's table for the duration of the Jury Trial.
Neither party has anything else to put on the record prior to the return of the Jurors.
10:15 a.m.  All 12 Jurors have returned to the courtroom.
Court informs the Jurors of note taking procedures.
10:17 a.m.  Atty Molepske gives his opening statement.
10:32 a.m.  Atty Schmidt gives his opening statement.
10:37 a.m.  Bailiff provides the Jurors with the notepads and pencils for note taking.
10:39 a.m.  Court informs the Jurors that the parties have stipulated to certain facts and these facts are read to the Jurors.
10:40 a.m.  Former Plover Officer Andrew Hopfensperger (currently employed with CAP Services).
Direct examination by Atty Molepske.
10:48 a.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
10:53 a.m.  Exhibit #P1 is referenced by Atty Molepske.
10:54 a.m.  Exhibit's #P2 & #P3 are referenced by Atty Molepske.
10:56 a.m.  Atty Molepske move's Exhibit's #P1-#P3 into evidence.  No objection by Atty Schmidt.  Received by the Court.
All 3 exhibit's are published to the Jury.
11:01 a.m.  Cross examination by Atty Schmidt.
11:06 a.m.  Re-direct by Atty Molepske.
Atty Schmidt has no further questions.
11:08 a.m.  Witness is excused.
11:09 a.m.  M.D. is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Molepske.
Witness identifies the defendant.
11:20 a.m.  Witness demonstrates how the defendant kicked her in the chest causing her to fall off the stairs.
11:43 a.m.  Atty Schmidt objects and would ask to speak with the Court in chambers.
Jurors are informed not to discuss this case.
Jurors are escorted from the courtroom.
11:44 a.m.  Atty Schmidt makes statements on the record as to why he objected with the questioning of Atty Molepske.
Atty Molepske makes statements. 
11:49 a.m.  Atty Schmidt makes additional statements and indicates that they can proceed.
Court reviews the documentation that had been provided.
Court makes further statmentes with regards to the other acts motion.
11:52 a.m.  Atty Schmidt would move for a mistrial.
Court asks Atty Molepske to justify his statements made with regards to the issue at hand.  Atty Molepske responds.
11:57 a.m.  Atty Schmidt makes further statements.
Court is concerned as to how the State is presenting its evidence and states the reasons on the record.
Court informs Atty Molepske that he is going outside of the parameters of his questioning with regards to the other acts evidence.
11:59 a.m.  Court will proceed with the Jury Trial and will inform the Jurors that parts of the questioning/testimony will be stricken from the record.
12:01 p.m.  Jurors have returned to the courtroom.
Court informs the Jurors that the remarks from the date, as stated on the record, will be stricken from the record and that they are to not consider this testimony when they do deliberate.  Court makes further statements on the record to the Jurors.
Atty Molepske continues his direct examination.
12:03 p.m.  Atty Molepske references exhibits #P1-#P3.
12:06 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Schmidt.
12:16 p.m.  Exhibit #P1 is referenced by Atty Schmidt.
12:24 p.m.  Re-direct by Atty Molepske.
Exhibit #P1 is referenced by Atty Molepske.
12:25 p.m.  Atty Schmidt has no re-cross.
Witness is excused.
Jurors are informed to return at 1:20 p.m.
Jurors are informed to not discuss this case amongst themselves or with anyone else.
12:26 p.m.  Jurors have been escorted from the courtroom.
Neither party has anything to put on the record.
12:27 p.m.  Court is in recess.
The parties are to return by 1:15 p.m.

Afternoon Clerk: Shirley

1:26 p.m. Court back in session. DA Molepske request the victim/witness to be present but will step out when the Defendant testifies. Parties stipulated.

1:28 p.m. Juror's are returned to the Courtroom. DA Molepske calls witness, A. B-D., who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam. Witness identifies the Defendant in the Courtroom. Exhibit P#1 is referred to during direct exam.

1:47 p.m. Cross exam by Atty Schmidt.

2:01 p.m. Redirect by DA Molepske. No further questions. Witness excused.
2:02 p.m. Juror returned to the Jury room for 10 mins. 

2:04 p.m. Atty Schmidt speaks with his client and informs the Court that the Defendant will testify. Court questions the Defendant and Atty Schmidt. Court finds that Defendant has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly understands his rights.

2:06 p.m. Court in recess for 5 mins
  
2:13 p.m. Court back in session. All 12 jurors are returned to Court. Atty Schmidt calls the Defendant, Tryone Brown, who testifies during direct exam. Exhibit P#1 is referred to during direct exam. 

2:34 p.m. Cross exam by DA Molepske.

3:09 p.m. Re-direct exam by Atty Schmidt. No further questions. Defendant  steps down from the stand.

3:11 p.m. Atty Schmidt calls witness, Plover Officer N. Shulfer, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.

3:14 p.m. Cross exam by DA Molepske.

3:19 p.m. Re-direct exam by Atty Schmidt. No further questions. No further witness. Witness steps down from the stand.

3:22 p.m. Court informs the Jurors that the testimonial part of this trial has been completed. Court questions the Jurors if they would like to stay or come back tomorrow to finish the trial. All 12 Jurors request to stay. Jurors are returned to the Jury room while the Court and parties finalize the Jury Instructions.

4:04 p.m. Court in recess for 10 mins.
4:16 p.m. Parties are present in the Courtroom. Jury Instructions are reviewed by the Parites.
4:29 p.m. Judge returns to the bench final correction to Jury Instructions. Parties receives and reviews final Jury instructions.

4:37 p.m. All 12 Jurors are returned to the Courtroom. Court informs the Jurors the Jury Instructions. 

5:16 p.m. DA Molepske makes closing statements.
5:39 p.m. Atty Schmidt makes closing statements.

6:00 p.m. Court informs the Jurors that the Court will be adjourning after DA Molepske rebuttel and they will have to return tommorrow by 8:00 a.m.
6:01 p.m. DA Molepske rebuttal.

6:12 p.m. Jurors are excused and shall return tommorrow by 8:00 a.m.
6:13 p.m. Court informs the Parties a minor correction to the Jury Instructions
6:14 p.m. Court is adjourned.
Clerk accounts for all three exhibits and in Clerk of Court's  possession.
Stipulation as to Street Clothes and Stipulated Facts **Sent for signature but document is a stipulation between parties. /s/ TBE (declined for signature by the Court)

Defendant Tyrone F. Brown in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:40 p.m. Court calls the case. DA Molepske states the appearances.
DA Molepske makes statements to the Court.
Court addresses the parties regarding the filing of the Motions.
DA Molepske states Victim Witness Notification has not been complied with, however the victim has not filed the letter requesting to notified of hearings.
DA Molepske makes statements in support of the  State's Motion for Other Acts Evidence.
Court questions DA Molepske.
DA Molepske responds and continues to make statements in support of the State's Motion.
Atty Schmidt give arguments against the State's Motion.
Court questions Atty Schmidt.
Atty Schmidt responds, and continues arguments against the Motion.
Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
For reasons stated on the record, State's Motion for Other Acts is granted regarding cases 05CF559, 07CM318, 04CM268, 04CM3360, 03CM452 & 07CM320.

Court questions DA Molepske.

No objections to sequestration.

No Objection.

Court questions Defense Motion in Limine #5.
DA Molepske makes statements regarding the motion.

BY THE COURT:
Defense Motion in Limine #5 is granted.  State's Motion in Limine #4 is granted.

Court questions Defense Motion in Limine 6.
No objection.

BY THE COURT:

Court questions State's Motion in Limine's  #6 - #10.

BY THE COURT:
State's Motion in Limine #6 - #10 are granted.

Atty Schmidt states for a matter of housekeeping, there was no State's Motion in Limine #9.

DA Molepske makes statements regarding Jury Instructions.
Court provides each party with a set of Proposed Jury Instructions.
Parties discuss jury instructions.

BY THE COURT:
Order of Counts: 2,3,4,1,5,6.

Parties continue to discuss jury instructions.
State requests the addition of 325 & 327.
Court questions Jury Instruction 275 and reads this instruction.
Atty Schmidt makes statements to the Court.
Court questions Counsel regarding Bailjumping charges.
Atty Schmidt responds.
DA Molespke makes statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Parties are to review the proposed jury instructions. Parties are to provide a Jury Instruction regarding stipulation of facts/ unstipulated facts no later that May 7, 2018.

Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone F. Brown in court with attorney Anne Renc. David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-105, 15CF-131, 15CF-168, 15CF-362 and 15CM-112.

1:22 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

These are before the Court on a motion to withdraw on this case.
Atty Renc addresses the Court regarding her request.

Atty Renc has been the first attorney on this case, in light of Defendant's uncomfortableness, it is prudent for Atty Renc to withdraw. Atty Renc understands the jury trial will not go tomorrow. There is a speedy trial demand on another case for jury trial tomorrow.

Court questions Defendant.
Defendant addresses the Court regarding his request for another attorney, lack of communication.
Atty Renc replies.

Discussions continue.

15CF-105 is the oldest of these cases.
Address is verified.

BY THE COURT:
Based on record that's been made today, will allow Atty Renc to withdraw as counsel on all of these files.

State is not taking a position in this case.

**Clerk put a signed copy of all the orders in each file**

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
